thread.title: UP Polls 2017: State will elect its own daughter, not adopted son, says Mayawati | The Indian Express
thread.title_full: UP Polls 2017: State will elect its own daughter, not adopted son, says Mayawati | The Indian Express

title: UP Polls 2017: State will elect its own daughter, not adopted son, says Mayawati | The Indian Express
text:
UP Polls 2017: State will elect its own daughter, not adopted son, says Mayawati UP Polls 2017: State will elect its own daughter, not adopted son, says Mayawati The BSP chief claimed that the people of Uttar Pradesh as well as the rest of the country were "fed up" with the almost three years of the Modi government at the Centre. Published:February 18, 2017 8:26 pm BSP Supremo Mayawati (PTI photo) 
The people of Uttar Pradesh have decided to ensure the victory of their “own daughter” rather than the “adopted son” in the ongoing state Assembly polls, BSP supremo Mayawati said on Saturday.”The people of Uttar Pradesh have made up their minds not to elect the adopted son (Prime Minister Narendra Modi ) but their own daughter (Mayawati) in this election,” she told a poll meeting. 
The BSP chief claimed that the people of Uttar Pradesh as well as the rest of the country were “fed up” with the almost three years of the Modi government at the Centre. Charging the Modi government with “burdening the population in the name of (fight against) black money”, she asked the prime minister to tell the people how much black money was deposited in banks post demonetisation. 
Mayawati also attacked Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav, holding him responsible for the “bad shape of law-and-order” in the state. She also claimed that SP patriarch Mulayam Singh Yadav ’s brother Shivpal was “working internally” to “cut the votes” of that party.
